intro: Shiia brachyacantha, commonly known as the short-stalked thornapple, is a shrub native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, followed by follicles that contain the seeds. Its leaves are opposite and often have a waxy texture, while its stems are covered in short, stiff hairs. Shiia brachyacantha is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
